name: Coaches Other Gigs Quiz | USA | 10 Questions

questions.text: Jimmy Johnson was the head coach for the NFL's Dallas Cowboys and Miami Dolphins. With which university did he win a national championship?
questions.explanation:
Miami (Fla).

	Johnson was the first head coach to win the NCAA football championship and the Super Bowl. He led Miami( Fla) to the national championship in 1987. He led the Cowboys to Super Bowl wins in 1992 and 1993. He coached the Dolphins from 1996-1999.

questions.text: Paul "Bear" Bryant led Alabama to six number one rankings while coaching at Alabama. He was also the head coach at all these universities except one. Which place was he NOT a head coach?
questions.explanation:
Arkansas.

	Bryant coached Maryland in 1945. He was at Kentucky from 1946 to 1953 and Texas A&M from 1954 to 1957. He went to Alabama in 1958 and coached there until 1982. He was given the nickname "Bear" because as a young man he once wrestled a bear.

questions.text: Billy Martin managed the Twins, Rangers, Tigers and Athletics. He was best known as the manager of the Yankees. How many times was Martin hired and fired as the Yankees skipper?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Martin managed the Twins (1969), Tigers (1971-1973), Rangers (1973-1975) and the A's (1980-1982). Martin was hired and fired by the Yankees 5 times (1975-1978, 1979, 1981, 1985, 1988. )He won the 1977 World Series and two AL pennants with New York.

questions.text: Joe Torre has had much success as the manager of the New York Yankees. He has managed three other teams as well. Which of these teams has Torre NOT managed?
questions.explanation:
Philadelphia Phillies.

	Torre coached the Mets from 1977 to 1981. His best finish was fourth. He managed the Braves from 1982 to 1984 and the Cards from 1990 to 1995. He was appointed manager of the Yankees in 1996.

questions.text: Jim Valvano's Wolfpack team won an improbable national championship as North Carolina State won the NCAA basketball championship in 1983. Before going to NC State where was Valavano the head coach?
questions.explanation:
Iona.

	Jimmy V coached at Iona from 1975 to 1980. He led the Gaels to two NCAA tourney appearances. Prior to his stint at Iona, Valvano coached at Bucknell (1972-1975) and at Johns Hopkins University for one season (1968-1969,) where he led his team to their first winning record in 24 years. His NC State team defeated the highly favored Cougars of Houston. Valvano died of cancer in 1993 and a foundation has been established in his name to fight the dreaded disease.

questions.text: Vince Lombardi led the  Green Bay Packers to seven championships  from 1959 to 1968. After leaving the Packers for what team did Lombardi become a head coach?
questions.explanation:
Washington Redskins.

	Lombardi became the head coach, general manager and part owner of the Redskins in 1969. He died one year later. Lombardi played college football at Fordham. Lombardi's record with the Redskins was 7-5-2. His record with the Packers was 98-30-4.

questions.text: Bobby Knight became famous (or infamous dependng upon your point of view) as the basketball coach at Indiana University. Before going to Indiana where was Knight the head coach?
questions.explanation:
Army.

	Bobby Knight was 24 years old when hired by Army, making him the youngest head coach in major college history. He led the Military Academy to four NIT berths in five years (1965-1971). At Indiana Knight one 3 national championships (1976-undefeated, 1981 and 1987). He was the coach at Texas Tech in the early 2000s.

questions.text: Casey Stengel won 10 AL pennants and 7 World Series championships with the Yankees. However, he coached three other major league teams as well. Which of these teams did he NOT manage?
questions.explanation:
Boston Red Sox.

	Although Stengel had great success with the Yankees (1949-1960) he had only a .508 winning percentage overall. With the Brooklyn Dodgers and Boston Braves his teams never finished higher than fifth place. He managed the expansion team New York Mets  from 1962-1965. His Mets teams lost over 450 games in his 4 year tenure. Stengel had a .623 winning percentage with the Yankees, but had a meager .394 winning percentage with the other teams he managed.

questions.text: Bill Russell won 8 straight NBA titles and 11  championships overall in his 13 years as a Boston Celtic. From 1966-1969 he was the player-coach of the Celtics. What other NBA teams did Russell coach?
options: Seattle and the Los Angeles Clippers
questions.explanation:
Seattle and Sacramento.

	Russell was the first African-American head coach in American major sports history. He coached the Supersonics from 1973 to 1977 and the Kings for part of the 1987 season.

questions.text: Don Shula won two Super Bowls as the head coach of the Miami Dolphins. What other NFL team was Shula a head coach for?
questions.explanation:
Baltimore Colts.

	Shula was with the Dolphins from 1970 to 1995. His Dolphin teams won two Super Bowls. The 1972 Dolphins are the first team to go undefeated (17-0), and by the close of the 20th century it remained a unique feat - they were still the only team to go undefeated. While at Baltimore, Shula's Colt team lost to Joe Namath and the Jets in the 1969 Super Bowl.  He coached the Colts from 1963 to 1969.
